name: Little Kulala

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I choose Little Kulala based on its incredible views of the sand dunes – which are the highest in the world at nearly 500 metres. Well, we arrived late afternoon and couldn’t see the dunes so we were a bit disappointed. Oh well, I thought, the lunar-type landscape is stunning. And, we were there at a very privileged time with the wildflowers in full bloom across what is normally desolate rocky and sandy earth. I was expecting barren earth and it was anything but.
reviews.title: Loved it! Surreal, exquisite, very different African experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Settled into our room – well, a small house really. Certainly most Parisians live in smaller apartments. Huge open glass walled room with views across the plains to the mountains in the distance, an obligatory bathroom the size of small town, outside shower and the best bit – a private plunge pool on a private deck. Bliss.
reviews.title: Very 'design'

description: Little Kulala Camp Premier Camp Little Kulala is the perfect gateway to the famous sights of Sossusvlei and is set in the exclusive Kulala Wilderness Reserve – a scenic area that has been successfully reclaimed for wildlife. About Little Kulala The 11 climate-controlled, thatched villas merge impeccably into the desert landscape, with exquisite décor and innovative bleached decks each with a private plunge pool – all placed amongst ancient camelthorn trees on the ephemeral Auab riverbed. The extensive use of neutral colours, gorgeous textures and natural light replicate the soothing pastel tones of the desert. Each villa has a rooftop ‘skybed’ for romantic stargazing, with both indoor and outdoor showers. An elegant entertainment area includes al fresco dining. Environment and Wildlife After years of habitat rehabilitation, Kulala wilderness reserve is once again home to of all forms of desert-adapted wildlife. Emphasis is on the varied dune fauna, prime access to Sossusvlei, spectacular scenery and the incredible night sky. Experiencing Little Kulala Visits to Sossusvlei through a private gate • guided nature drives and walks • world-class stargazing • balloon safari (extra cost) • scorpion walks after dark • horse riding in the immediate area (extra cost) • quad biking from a nearby camp.
